metadata.title: CVE-2019-11741 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A compromised sandboxed content process can perform a Universal Cross-siteScripting (UXSS) attack on content from any site it can cause to be loadedin the same process. Because addons.mozilla.org and accounts.firefox.comhave close ties to the Firefox product, malicious manipulation of thesesites within the browser can potentially be used to modify a user's Firefoxconfiguration. These two sites will now be isolated into their own processand not allowed to be loaded in a standard content process. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 69.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11741` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 69.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
firefox-geckodriver - 69.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
firefox-mozsymbols - 69.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '69.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.4').
